summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear and produce financial records for Jeffrey E. Epstein's account 0043811863 from 2001-2004. The subpoena is related to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the matter for which the subpoena is issued.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of financial records for an account in his name (0043811863) covering the period from January 1, 2001, through December 31, 2004.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the legal command.

connections.description: The subpoena for Epstein's financial records is issued in the context of the criminal case against Maxwell, indicating their alleged connection in the matters under investigation.
Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Records Production
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, to testify and produce specified financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued on July 19, 2021, demanding the production of financial records for a specific Jeffrey Epstein account (0043811863) from 2001 to 2004.
The subpoena is directly related to the federal criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
The subpoena was signed by then-U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, indicating high-level DOJ involvement in the Maxwell prosecution.
The demanded records include 'all usage' and 'each monthly invoice' for the specified account, suggesting a detailed financial investigation into Epstein's activities during that period.
Failure to comply is stated to constitute contempt of court, subjecting the recipient to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
